TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MsmqTransportBindingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqBindingElementBase
Public NotInheritable Class MsmqTransportBindingElement Inherits MsmqBindingElementBase

Docs.summary: Represents the binding element used to specify the queuing communication properties for a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service that uses the native Message Queuing (MSMQ) protocol.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement> enables the user to set the properties of the queued communication channel. The queued communication channel uses Message Queuing for its transport.
This binding element is the default binding element used by the Message Queuing standard binding (<xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding>).
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ImperativeNetMsmq#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_imperativenetmsmq/cs/service.cs#0)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory<TChannel> BuildChannelFactory<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory`1<!!TChannel> BuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) cil managed
Public Overrides Function BuildChannelFactory(Of TChannel) (context As BindingContext) As IChannelFactory(Of TChannel)
override this.BuildChannelFactory : System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext -> System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory<'Channel>

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel factory.
Docs.summary: Builds a channel factory using the context provided.
Docs.returns: A Message Queuing (MSMQ) channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing Message Queuing applications.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A channel factory is created and initialized using the properties that have been set in the binding element. The initialized channel factory is then used to create output channels that can be used to send messages to a message queue.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ImperativeNetMsmq#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_imperativenetmsmq/cs/snippets.cs#7)]

Docs.exception: The TChannel is not IOutputChannel or IOutputSessionChannel.

ExactlyOnce is true and Durable is false.
-or-
UseActiveDirectory is true and QueueTransferProtocol is not Native.
-or-
CustomDeadLetterQueue is not null and DeadLetterQueue is not Custom.
-or-
DeadLetterQueue is set to Custom on Windows 2003/XP.
-or-
ExactlyOnce is false and DeadLetterQueue is Custom.
-or-
CustomDeadLetterQueue is set and either there is no write permission to write to the queue, or the queue does not exist.
-or-
CustomDeadLetterQueue is non-transactional.
-or-
MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode is set to WindowsDomain and MSMQ is installed without ActiveDirectory integration.
-or-
MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode is None and MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is not None.
-or-
MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode is Certificate or WindowsDomain and MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is None.
-or-
MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is EncryptAndSign and UseActiveDirectory is false.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing (MSMQ) message objects.
Docs.value: An integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing message objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The internal Message Queuing message object pool is used to avoid allocations of these objects when sending and receiving messages. The maximum pool size is a performance-tuning parameter. The default value is 8.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration value that indicates the queued communication channel transport that this binding uses.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that indicates the transport used for message delivery between queue managers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Message Queuing (MSMQ) does not support Active Directory addressing when using SOAP Reliable Messaging Protocol (SRMP), so do not set <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.QueueTransferProtocol%2A> to <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol.Srmp> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol.Srmp> when <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.UseActiveDirectory%2A> is set to `true`.

.property instance string Scheme
Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Scheme As String

member this.Scheme : string

Docs.summary: Returns a that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.
Docs.value: A that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.Scheme%2A> property returns the string "net.msmq".
The Message Queuing (MSMQ) queued transport supports several addressing schemes, including net.msmq.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ImperativeNetMsmq#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_imperativenetmsmq/cs/snippets.cs#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool UseActiveDirectory { get; set; }
.property instance bool UseActiveDirectory
Public Property UseActiveDirectory As Boolean
public: property bool UseActiveDirectory { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseActiveDirectory : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory.
Docs.value: if queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Message Queuing (MSMQ) queue addresses can consist of path names or direct format names. With a direct format name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using DNS, NetBIOS, or IP. With a path name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using Active Directory.
By default, the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) queued transport converts the URI of a message queue to a direct format name. By setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.UseActiveDirectory%2A> property to `true`, an application can specify that the queued transport should resolve the computer name using Active Directory rather than DNS, NetBIOS, or IP.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ImperativeNetMsmq#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_imperativenetmsmq/cs/snippets.cs#5)]
